element.name: use
element.description: home | work | temp | old | billing - purpose of this address
element.definition: The purpose of this address.
element.comment: Applications can assume that an address is current unless it explicitly says that it is temporary or old.

binding.name: AddressUse
binding.description: The use of an address.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: type
element.definition: Distinguishes between physical addresses (those you can visit) and mailing addresses (e.g. PO Boxes and care-of addresses). Most addresses are both.
element.comment: The definition of Address states that "address is intended to describe postal addresses, not physical locations". However, many applications track whether an address has a dual purpose of being a location that can be visited as well as being a valid delivery destination, and Postal addresses are often used as proxies for physical locations (also see the [Location](location.html#) resource).

binding.name: AddressType
binding.description: The type of an address (physical / postal).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: text
element.definition: Specifies the entire address as it should be displayed e.g. on a postal label. This may be provided instead of or as well as the specific parts.
element.comment: Can provide both a text representation and parts. Applications updating an address SHALL ensure that when both text and parts are present, no content is included in the text that isn't found in a part.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: line
element.description: Street name, number, direction & P.O. Box etc.
element.definition: This component contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: city
element.definition: The name of the city, town, suburb, village or other community or delivery center.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: district
element.definition: The name of the administrative area (county).
element.comment: District is sometimes known as county, but in some regions 'county' is used in place of city (municipality), so county name should be conveyed in city instead.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: state
element.definition: Sub-unit of a country with limited sovereignty in a federally organized country. A code may be used if codes are in common use (e.g. US 2 letter state codes).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: postalCode
element.definition: A postal code designating a region defined by the postal service.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: country
element.description: Country (e.g. can be ISO 3166 2 or 3 letter code)
element.definition: Country - a nation as commonly understood or generally accepted.
element.comment: ISO 3166 3 letter codes can be used in place of a human readable country name.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: period
element.description: Time period when address was/is in use
element.definition: Time period when address was/is in use.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this AllergyIntolerance by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
element.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/resource.html#identifiers)). It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types. For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: clinicalStatus
element.definition: The clinical status of the allergy or intolerance.
element.comment: Refer to [discussion](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#Special-Case) if clincalStatus is missing data. The data type is CodeableConcept because clinicalStatus has some clinical judgment involved, such that there might need to be more specificity than the required FHIR value set allows. For example, a SNOMED coding might allow for additional specificity.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: verificationStatus
element.definition: Assertion about certainty associated with the propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance (including pharmaceutical product).
element.comment: The data type is CodeableConcept because verificationStatus has some clinical judgment involved, such that there might need to be more specificity than the required FHIR value set allows. For example, a SNOMED coding might allow for additional specificity.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: type
element.definition: Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for the reaction risk.
element.comment: Allergic (typically immune-mediated) reactions have been traditionally regarded as an indicator for potential escalation to significant future risk. Contemporary knowledge suggests that some reactions previously thought to be immune-mediated are, in fact, non-immune, but in some cases can still pose a life threatening risk. It is acknowledged that many clinicians might not be in a position to distinguish the mechanism of a particular reaction. Often the term "allergy" is used rather generically and may overlap with the use of "intolerance" - in practice the boundaries between these two concepts might not be well-defined or understood. This data element is included nevertheless, because many legacy systems have captured this attribute. Immunologic testing may provide supporting evidence for the basis of the reaction and the causative substance, but no tests are 100% sensitive or specific for sensitivity to a particular substance. If, as is commonly the case, it is unclear whether the reaction is due to an allergy or an intolerance, then the type element should be omitted from the resource.

binding.name: AllergyIntoleranceType
binding.description: Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for a Reaction Risk.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: category
element.definition: Category of the identified substance.
element.comment: This data element has been included because it is currently being captured in some clinical systems. This data can be derived from the substance where coding systems are used, and is effectively redundant in that situation. When searching on category, consider the implications of AllergyIntolerance resources without a category. For example, when searching on category = medication, medication allergies that don't have a category valued will not be returned. Refer to [search](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/search.html) for more information on how to search category with a :missing modifier to get allergies that don't have a category. Additionally, category should be used with caution because category can be subjective based on the sender.

binding.name: AllergyIntoleranceCategory
binding.description: Category of an identified substance associated with allergies or intolerances.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: criticality
element.definition: Estimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of the reaction to the identified substance.
element.comment: The default criticality value for any propensity to an adverse reaction should be 'Low Risk', indicating at the very least a relative contraindication to deliberate or voluntary exposure to the substance. 'High Risk' is flagged if the clinician has identified a propensity for a more serious or potentially life-threatening reaction, such as anaphylaxis, and implies an absolute contraindication to deliberate or voluntary exposure to the substance. If this element is missing, the criticality is unknown (though it may be known elsewhere). Systems that capture a severity at the condition level are actually representing the concept of criticality whereas the severity documented at the reaction level is representing the true reaction severity. Existing systems that are capturing both condition criticality and reaction severity may use the term "severity" to represent both. Criticality is the worst it could be in the future (i.e. situation-agnostic) whereas severity is situation-dependent.

binding.name: AllergyIntoleranceCriticality
binding.description: Estimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of a reaction to an identified substance.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: code
element.description: Code that identifies the allergy or intolerance
element.definition: Code for an allergy or intolerance statement (either a positive or a negated/excluded statement). This may be a code for a substance or pharmaceutical product that is considered to be responsible for the adverse reaction risk (e.g., "Latex"), an allergy or intolerance condition (e.g., "Latex allergy"), or a negated/excluded code for a specific substance or class (e.g., "No latex allergy") or a general or categorical negated statement (e.g., "No known allergy", "No known drug allergies"). Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different from the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but it must be consistent with it. For instance, it may be a more specific substance (e.g. a brand medication) or a composite product that includes the identified substance. It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'. If a receiving system is unable to confirm that AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance falls within the semantic scope of AllergyIntolerance.code, then the receiving system should ignore AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance.
element.comment: It is strongly recommended that this element be populated using a terminology, where possible. For example, some terminologies used include RxNorm, SNOMED CT, DM+D, NDFRT, ICD-9, IDC-10, UNII, and ATC. Plain text should only be used if there is no appropriate terminology available. Additional details can be specified in the text. When a substance or product code is specified for the 'code' element, the "default" semantic context is that this is a positive statement of an allergy or intolerance (depending on the value of the 'type' element, if present) condition to the specified substance/product. In the corresponding SNOMED CT allergy model, the specified substance/product is the target (destination) of the "Causative agent" relationship. The 'substanceExposureRisk' extension is available as a structured and more flexible alternative to the 'code' element for making positive or negative allergy or intolerance statements. This extension provides the capability to make "no known allergy" (or "no risk of adverse reaction") statements regarding any coded substance/product (including cases when a pre-coordinated "no allergy to x" concept for that substance/product does not exist). If the 'substanceExposureRisk' extension is present, the AllergyIntolerance.code element SHALL be omitted.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: patient
element.definition: The patient who has the allergy or intolerance.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: encounter
element.description: Encounter when the allergy or intolerance was asserted
element.definition: The encounter when the allergy or intolerance was asserted.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: onset
element.description: When allergy or intolerance was identified
element.definition: Estimated or actual date, date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: recordedDate
element.description: Date first version of the resource instance was recorded
element.definition: The recordedDate represents when this particular AllergyIntolerance record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: recorder
element.definition: Individual who recorded the record and takes responsibility for its content.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: asserter
element.description: Source of the information about the allergy
element.definition: The source of the information about the allergy that is recorded.
element.comment: The recorder takes responsibility for the content, but can reference the source from where they got it.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: lastOccurrence
element.description: Date(/time) of last known occurrence of a reaction
element.definition: Represents the date and/or time of the last known occurrence of a reaction event.
element.comment: This date may be replicated by one of the Onset of Reaction dates. Where a textual representation of the date of last occurrence is required e.g. 'In Childhood, '10 years ago' the Comment element should be used.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: note
element.description: Additional text not captured in other fields
element.definition: Additional narrative about the propensity for the Adverse Reaction, not captured in other fields.
element.comment: For example: including reason for flagging a seriousness of 'High Risk'; and instructions related to future exposure or administration of the substance, such as administration within an Intensive Care Unit or under corticosteroid cover. The notes should be related to an allergy or intolerance as a condition in general and not related to any particular episode of it. For episode notes and descriptions, use AllergyIntolerance.event.description and AllergyIntolerance.event.notes.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: reaction
element.description: Adverse Reaction Events linked to exposure to substance
element.definition: Details about each adverse reaction event linked to exposure to the identified substance.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: substance
element.description: Specific substance or pharmaceutical product considered to be responsible for event
element.definition: Identification of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) considered to be responsible for the Adverse Reaction event. Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different from the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but it must be consistent with it. For instance, it may be a more specific substance (e.g. a brand medication) or a composite product that includes the identified substance. It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'. If a receiving system is unable to confirm that AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance falls within the semantic scope of AllergyIntolerance.code, then the receiving system should ignore AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance.
element.comment: Coding of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) with a terminology capable of triggering decision support should be used wherever possible. The 'code' element allows for the use of a specific substance or pharmaceutical product, or a group or class of substances. In the case of an allergy or intolerance to a class of substances, (for example, "penicillins"), the 'reaction.substance' element could be used to code the specific substance that was identified as having caused the reaction (for example, "amoxycillin"). Duplication of the value in the 'code' and 'reaction.substance' elements is acceptable when a specific substance has been recorded in 'code'.

binding.name: SubstanceCode
binding.description: Codes defining the type of the substance (including pharmaceutical products).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: manifestation
element.description: Clinical symptoms/signs associated with the Event
element.definition: Clinical symptoms and/or signs that are observed or associated with the adverse reaction event.
element.comment: Manifestation can be expressed as a single word, phrase or brief description. For example: nausea, rash or no reaction. It is preferable that manifestation should be coded with a terminology, where possible. The values entered here may be used to display on an application screen as part of a list of adverse reactions, as recommended in the UK NHS CUI guidelines. Terminologies commonly used include, but are not limited to, SNOMED CT or ICD10.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: description
element.description: Description of the event as a whole
element.definition: Text description about the reaction as a whole, including details of the manifestation if required.
element.comment: Use the description to provide any details of a particular event of the occurred reaction such as circumstances, reaction specifics, what happened before/after. Information, related to the event, but not describing a particular care should be captured in the comment field. For example: at the age of four, the patient was given penicillin for strep throat and subsequently developed severe hives.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: onset
element.definition: Record of the date and/or time of the onset of the Reaction.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: severity
element.description: mild | moderate | severe (of event as a whole)
element.definition: Clinical assessment of the severity of the reaction event as a whole, potentially considering multiple different manifestations.
element.comment: It is acknowledged that this assessment is very subjective. There may be some specific practice domains where objective scales have been applied. Objective scales can be included in this model as extensions.

binding.name: AllergyIntoleranceSeverity
binding.description: Clinical assessment of the severity of a reaction event as a whole, potentially considering multiple different manifestations.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: exposureRoute
element.description: How the subject was exposed to the substance
element.definition: Identification of the route by which the subject was exposed to the substance.
element.comment: Coding of the route of exposure with a terminology should be used wherever possible.

binding.name: RouteOfAdministration
binding.description: A coded concept describing the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto the body of a subject.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: note
element.description: Text about event not captured in other fields
element.definition: Additional text about the adverse reaction event not captured in other fields.
element.comment: Use this field to record information indirectly related to a particular event and not captured in the description. For example: Clinical records are no longer available, recorded based on information provided to the patient by her mother and her mother is deceased.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: author
element.definition: The individual responsible for making the annotation.
element.comment: Organization is used when there's no need for specific attribution as to who made the comment.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: time
element.definition: Indicates when this particular annotation was made.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: text
element.definition: The text of the annotation in markdown format.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: contentType
element.description: Mime type of the content, with charset etc.
element.definition: Identifies the type of the data in the attachment and allows a method to be chosen to interpret or render the data. Includes mime type parameters such as charset where appropriate.

binding.name: MimeType
binding.description: The mime type of an attachment. Any valid mime type is allowed.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: language
element.definition: The human language of the content. The value can be any valid value according to BCP 47.

binding.name: Language
binding.description: A human language.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: data
element.definition: The actual data of the attachment - a sequence of bytes, base64 encoded.
element.comment: The base64-encoded data SHALL be expressed in the same character set as the base resource XML or JSON.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: url
element.description: Uri where the data can be found
element.definition: A location where the data can be accessed.
element.comment: If both data and url are provided, the url SHALL point to the same content as the data contains. Urls may be relative references or may reference transient locations such as a wrapping envelope using cid: though this has ramifications for using signatures. Relative URLs are interpreted relative to the service url, like a resource reference, rather than relative to the resource itself. If a URL is provided, it SHALL resolve to actual data.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: size
element.description: Number of bytes of content (if url provided)
element.definition: The number of bytes of data that make up this attachment (before base64 encoding, if that is done).
element.comment: The number of bytes is redundant if the data is provided as a base64binary, but is useful if the data is provided as a url reference.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: hash
element.definition: The calculated hash of the data using SHA-1. Represented using base64.
element.comment: The hash is calculated on the data prior to base64 encoding, if the data is based64 encoded. The hash is not intended to support digital signatures. Where protection against malicious threats a digital signature should be considered, see [Provenance.signature](provenance-definitions.html#Provenance.signature) for mechanism to protect a resource with a digital signature.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: title
element.description: Label to display in place of the data
element.definition: A label or set of text to display in place of the data.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: creation
element.definition: The date that the attachment was first created.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: modifierExtension
element.description: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

constraint.name: ext-1
constraint.message: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.name: outcomeCodeableConcept
element.definition: Identifies the outcome at the point when the status of the activity is assessed. For example, the outcome of an education activity could be patient understands (or not).
element.comment: Note that this should not duplicate the activity status (e.g. completed or in progress).

binding.name: CarePlanActivityOutcome
binding.description: Identifies the results of the activity.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: outcomeReference
element.definition: Details of the outcome or action resulting from the activity. The reference to an "event" resource, such as Procedure or Encounter or Observation, is the result/outcome of the activity itself. The activity can be conveyed using CarePlan.activity.detail OR using the CarePlan.activity.reference (a reference to a “request” resource).
element.comment: The activity outcome is independent of the outcome of the related goal(s). For example, if the goal is to achieve a target body weight of 150 lbs and an activity is defined to diet, then the activity outcome could be calories consumed whereas the goal outcome is an observation for the actual body weight measured.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: progress
element.definition: Notes about the adherence/status/progress of the activity.
element.comment: This element should NOT be used to describe the activity to be performed - that occurs either within the resource pointed to by activity.detail.reference or in activity.detail.description.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: reference
element.description: Activity details defined in specific resource
element.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.
element.comment: Standard extension exists ([resource-pertainsToGoal](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extension-resource-pertainstogoal.html)) that allows goals to be referenced from any of the referenced resources in CarePlan.activity.reference. The goal should be visible when the resource referenced by CarePlan.activity.reference is viewed independently from the CarePlan. Requests that are pointed to by a CarePlan using this element should *not* point to this CarePlan using the "basedOn" element. i.e. Requests that are part of a CarePlan are not "based on" the CarePlan.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: detail
element.definition: A simple summary of a planned activity suitable for a general care plan system (e.g. form driven) that doesn't know about specific resources such as procedure etc.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: kind
element.description: Appointment | CommunicationRequest | DeviceRequest | MedicationRequest | NutritionOrder | Task | ServiceRequest | VisionPrescription
element.definition: A description of the kind of resource the in-line definition of a care plan activity is representing. The CarePlan.activity.detail is an in-line definition when a resource is not referenced using CarePlan.activity.reference. For example, a MedicationRequest, a ServiceRequest, or a CommunicationRequest.

binding.name: CarePlanActivityKind
binding.description: Resource types defined as part of FHIR that can be represented as in-line definitions of a care plan activity.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: instantiatesCanonical
element.definition: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan activity.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: instantiatesUri
element.definition: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan activity.
element.comment: This might be an HTML page, PDF, etc. or could just be a non-resolvable URI identifier.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: code
element.definition: Detailed description of the type of planned activity; e.g. what lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.
element.comment: Tends to be less relevant for activities involving particular products. Codes should not convey negation - use "prohibited" instead.

binding.name: CarePlanActivityType
binding.description: Detailed description of the type of activity; e.g. What lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: reasonCode
element.description: Why activity should be done or why activity was prohibited
element.definition: Provides the rationale that drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan or the reason why the activity was prohibited.
element.comment: This could be a diagnosis code. If a full condition record exists or additional detail is needed, use reasonCondition instead.

binding.name: CarePlanActivityReason
binding.description: Identifies why a care plan activity is needed. Can include any health condition codes as well as such concepts as "general wellness", prophylaxis, surgical preparation, etc.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: reasonReference
element.definition: Indicates another resource, such as the health condition(s), whose existence justifies this request and drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan.
element.comment: Conditions can be identified at the activity level that are not identified as reasons for the overall plan.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: goal
element.definition: Internal reference that identifies the goals that this activity is intended to contribute towards meeting.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: status
element.description: not-started | scheduled | in-progress | on-hold | completed | cancelled | stopped | unknown | entered-in-error
element.definition: Identifies what progress is being made for the specific activity.
element.comment: Some aspects of status can be inferred based on the resources linked in actionTaken. Note that "status" is only as current as the plan was most recently updated. The unknown code is not to be used to convey other statuses. The unknown code should be used when one of the statuses applies, but the authoring system doesn't know the current state of the activity.

binding.name: CarePlanActivityStatus
binding.description: Codes that reflect the current state of a care plan activity within its overall life cycle.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: statusReason
element.definition: Provides reason why the activity isn't yet started, is on hold, was cancelled, etc.
element.comment: Will generally not be present if status is "complete". Be sure to prompt to update this (or at least remove the existing value) if the status is changed.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: doNotPerform
element.description: If true, activity is prohibiting action
element.definition: If true, indicates that the described activity is one that must NOT be engaged in when following the plan. If false, or missing, indicates that the described activity is one that should be engaged in when following the plan.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because it marks an activity as an activity that is not to be performed.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: scheduled
element.definition: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: location
element.definition: Identifies the facility where the activity will occur; e.g. home, hospital, specific clinic, etc.
element.comment: May reference a specific clinical location or may identify a type of location.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: performer
element.definition: Identifies who's expected to be involved in the activity.
element.comment: A performer MAY also be a participant in the care plan.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: product
element.definition: Identifies the food, drug or other product to be consumed or supplied in the activity.

binding.name: CarePlanProduct
binding.description: A product supplied or administered as part of a care plan activity.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: dailyAmount
element.definition: Identifies the quantity expected to be consumed in a given day.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: quantity
element.definition: Identifies the quantity expected to be supplied, administered or consumed by the subject.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: description
element.description: Extra info describing activity to perform
element.definition: This provides a textual description of constraints on the intended activity occurrence, including relation to other activities. It may also include objectives, pre-conditions and end-conditions. Finally, it may convey specifics about the activity such as body site, method, route, etc.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this care plan by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
element.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/resource.html#identifiers)). It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types. For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: instantiatesCanonical
element.definition: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: instantiatesUri
element.definition: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan.
element.comment: This might be an HTML page, PDF, etc. or could just be a non-resolvable URI identifier.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: basedOn
element.definition: A care plan that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this care plan.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: replaces
element.definition: Completed or terminated care plan whose function is taken by this new care plan.
element.comment: The replacement could be because the initial care plan was immediately rejected (due to an issue) or because the previous care plan was completed, but the need for the action described by the care plan remains ongoing.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: partOf
element.definition: A larger care plan of which this particular care plan is a component or step.
element.comment: Each care plan is an independent request, such that having a care plan be part of another care plan can cause issues with cascading statuses. As such, this element is still being discussed.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: status
element.description: draft | active | on-hold | revoked | completed | entered-in-error | unknown
element.definition: Indicates whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions or is now a historical record.
element.comment:
The unknown code is not to be used to convey other statuses. The unknown code should be used when one of the statuses applies, but the authoring system doesn't know the current state of the care plan.
This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the code entered-in-error that marks the plan as not currently valid.

binding.description: Indicates whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions or is now a historical record.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: intent
element.definition: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the care plan and where the care plan fits into the workflow chain.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the intent alters when and how the resource is actually applicable.

binding.description: Codes indicating the degree of authority/intentionality associated with a care plan

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: category
element.definition: Type of plan.
element.comment: There may be multiple axes of categorization and one plan may serve multiple purposes. In some cases, this may be redundant with references to CarePlan.concern.

binding.name: CarePlanCategory
binding.description: Identifies what "kind" of plan this is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing plans; e.g. "Home health", "psychiatric", "asthma", "disease management", etc.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: AssessPlan
element.definition: Type of plan.
element.comment: There may be multiple axes of categorization and one plan may serve multiple purposes. In some cases, this may be redundant with references to CarePlan.concern.

binding.name: CarePlanCategory
binding.description: Identifies what "kind" of plan this is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing plans; e.g. "Home health", "psychiatric", "asthma", "disease management", etc.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: title
element.description: Human-friendly name for the care plan
element.definition: Human-friendly name for the care plan.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: description
element.definition: A description of the scope and nature of the plan.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: subject
element.description: Who the care plan is for
element.definition: Who care plan is for.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: encounter
element.definition: The Encounter during which this CarePlan was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
element.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter. CarePlan activities conducted as a result of the care plan may well occur as part of other encounters.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: period
element.definition: Indicates when the plan did (or is intended to) come into effect and end.
element.comment: Any activities scheduled as part of the plan should be constrained to the specified period regardless of whether the activities are planned within a single encounter/episode or across multiple encounters/episodes (e.g. the longitudinal management of a chronic condition).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: created
element.definition: Represents when this particular CarePlan record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: author
element.description: Who is the designated responsible party
element.definition: When populated, the author is responsible for the care plan. The care plan is attributed to the author.
element.comment: The author may also be a contributor. For example, an organization can be an author, but not listed as a contributor.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: contributor
element.description: Who provided the content of the care plan
element.definition: Identifies the individual(s) or organization who provided the contents of the care plan.
element.comment: Collaborative care plans may have multiple contributors.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: careTeam
element.definition: Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care envisioned by this plan.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: addresses
element.definition: Identifies the conditions/problems/concerns/diagnoses/etc. whose management and/or mitigation are handled by this plan.
element.comment: When the diagnosis is related to an allergy or intolerance, the Condition and AllergyIntolerance resources can both be used. However, to be actionable for decision support, using Condition alone is not sufficient as the allergy or intolerance condition needs to be represented as an AllergyIntolerance.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: supportingInfo
element.description: Information considered as part of plan
element.definition: Identifies portions of the patient's record that specifically influenced the formation of the plan. These might include comorbidities, recent procedures, limitations, recent assessments, etc.
element.comment: Use "concern" to identify specific conditions addressed by the care plan.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: goal
element.definition: Describes the intended objective(s) of carrying out the care plan.
element.comment: Goal can be achieving a particular change or merely maintaining a current state or even slowing a decline.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: activity
element.description: Action to occur as part of plan
element.definition: Identifies a planned action to occur as part of the plan. For example, a medication to be used, lab tests to perform, self-monitoring, education, etc.

constraint.name: cpl-3
constraint.message: Provide a reference or detail, not both

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: note
element.definition: General notes about the care plan not covered elsewhere.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this care team by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
element.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/resource.html#identifiers)). It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types. For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: status
element.definition: Indicates the current state of the care team.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the code entered-in-error that marks the care team as not currently valid.

binding.description: Indicates whether the team is current , represents future intentions or is now a historical record.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: category
element.definition: Identifies what kind of team. This is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing teams, such as care plan team, episode of care team, longitudinal care team.
element.comment: There may be multiple axis of categorization and one team may serve multiple purposes.

binding.name: CareTeamCategory
binding.description: Indicates the type of care team.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: name
element.description: Name of the team, such as crisis assessment team
element.definition: A label for human use intended to distinguish like teams. E.g. the "red" vs. "green" trauma teams.
element.comment: The meaning/purpose of the team is conveyed in CareTeam.category. This element may also convey semantics of the team (e.g. "Red trauma team"), but its primary purpose is to distinguish between identical teams in a human-friendly way. ("Team 18735" isn't as friendly.).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: subject
element.definition: Identifies the patient or group whose intended care is handled by the team.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: encounter
element.definition: The Encounter during which this CareTeam was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
element.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: period
element.definition: Indicates when the team did (or is intended to) come into effect and end.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: participant
element.definition: Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care team.

constraint.name: ctm-1
constraint.message: CareTeam.participant.onBehalfOf can only be populated when CareTeam.participant.member is a Practitioner

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: reasonCode
element.definition: Describes why the care team exists.

binding.name: CareTeamReason
binding.description: Indicates the reason for the care team.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: reasonReference
element.definition: Condition(s) that this care team addresses.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: managingOrganization
element.description: Organization responsible for the care team
element.definition: The organization responsible for the care team.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: telecom
element.description: A contact detail for the care team (that applies to all members)
element.definition: A central contact detail for the care team (that applies to all members).
element.comment: The ContactPoint.use code of home is not appropriate to use. These contacts are not the contact details of individual care team members.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: note
element.definition: Comments made about the CareTeam.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: role
element.definition: Indicates specific responsibility of an individual within the care team, such as "Primary care physician", "Trained social worker counselor", "Caregiver", etc.
element.comment: Roles may sometimes be inferred by type of Practitioner. These are relationships that hold only within the context of the care team. General relationships should be handled as properties of the Patient resource directly.

binding.description: Indicates specific responsibility of an individual within the care team, such as Primary physician, Team coordinator, Caregiver, etc.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: member
element.definition: The specific person or organization who is participating/expected to participate in the care team.
element.comment:
Patient only needs to be listed if they have a role other than "subject of care".
Member is optional because some participants may be known only by their role, particularly in draft plans.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: onBehalfOf
element.definition: The organization of the practitioner.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: period
element.definition: Indicates when the specific member or organization did (or is intended to) come into effect and end.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this condition by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
element.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/resource.html#identifiers)). It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types. For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: clinicalStatus
element.description: active | recurrence | relapse | inactive | remission | resolved
element.definition: The clinical status of the condition.
element.comment: The data type is CodeableConcept because clinicalStatus has some clinical judgment involved, such that there might need to be more specificity than the required FHIR value set allows. For example, a SNOMED coding might allow for additional specificity.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: verificationStatus
element.description: unconfirmed | provisional | differential | confirmed | refuted | entered-in-error
element.definition: The verification status to support the clinical status of the condition.
element.comment: verificationStatus is not required. For example, when a patient has abdominal pain in the ED, there is not likely going to be a verification status. The data type is CodeableConcept because verificationStatus has some clinical judgment involved, such that there might need to be more specificity than the required FHIR value set allows. For example, a SNOMED coding might allow for additional specificity.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: category
element.definition: A category assigned to the condition.
element.comment: The categorization is often highly contextual and may appear poorly differentiated or not very useful in other contexts.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: severity
element.definition: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.
element.comment: Coding of the severity with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

binding.name: ConditionSeverity
binding.description: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: code
element.description: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis
element.definition: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

binding.description: Valueset to describe the actual problem experienced by the patient

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: bodySite
element.definition: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.
element.comment: Only used if not implicit in code found in Condition.code. If the use case requires attributes from the BodySite resource (e.g. to identify and track separately) then use the standard extension [bodySite](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extension-bodysite.html). May be a summary code, or a reference to a very precise definition of the location, or both.

binding.name: BodySite
binding.description: Codes describing anatomical locations. May include laterality.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: subject
element.definition: Indicates the patient or group who the condition record is associated with.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: encounter
element.definition: The Encounter during which this Condition was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
element.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter. This record indicates the encounter this particular record is associated with. In the case of a "new" diagnosis reflecting ongoing/revised information about the condition, this might be distinct from the first encounter in which the underlying condition was first "known".

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: onset
element.description: Estimated or actual date, date-time, or age
element.definition: Estimated or actual date or date-time the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.
element.comment: Age is generally used when the patient reports an age at which the Condition began to occur.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: abatement
element.definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.
element.comment: There is no explicit distinction between resolution and remission because in many cases the distinction is not clear. Age is generally used when the patient reports an age at which the Condition abated. If there is no abatement element, it is unknown whether the condition has resolved or entered remission; applications and users should generally assume that the condition is still valid. When abatementString exists, it implies the condition is abated.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: recordedDate
element.definition: The recordedDate represents when this particular Condition record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: recorder
element.definition: Individual who recorded the record and takes responsibility for its content.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: asserter
element.definition: Individual who is making the condition statement.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: stage
element.definition: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.

constraint.name: con-1
constraint.message: Stage SHALL have summary or assessment

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: evidence
element.definition: Supporting evidence / manifestations that are the basis of the Condition's verification status, such as evidence that confirmed or refuted the condition.
element.comment: The evidence may be a simple list of coded symptoms/manifestations, or references to observations or formal assessments, or both.

constraint.name: con-2
constraint.message: evidence SHALL have code or details

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: note
element.definition: Additional information about the Condition. This is a general notes/comments entry for description of the Condition, its diagnosis and prognosis.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: code
element.definition: A manifestation or symptom that led to the recording of this condition.

binding.name: ManifestationOrSymptom
binding.description: Codes that describe the manifestation or symptoms of a condition.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: detail
element.definition: Links to other relevant information, including pathology reports.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: summary
element.definition: A simple summary of the stage such as "Stage 3". The determination of the stage is disease-specific.

binding.name: ConditionStage
binding.description: Codes describing condition stages (e.g. Cancer stages).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: assessment
element.definition: Reference to a formal record of the evidence on which the staging assessment is based.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: type
element.definition: The kind of staging, such as pathological or clinical staging.

binding.name: ConditionStageType
binding.description: Codes describing the kind of condition staging (e.g. clinical or pathological).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: name
element.description: Name of an individual to contact
element.definition: The name of an individual to contact.
element.comment: If there is no named individual, the telecom information is for the organization as a whole.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: telecom
element.description: Contact details for individual or organization
element.definition: The contact details for the individual (if a name was provided) or the organization.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: system
element.description: phone | fax | email | pager | url | sms | other
element.definition: Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact.

binding.name: ContactPointSystem
binding.description: Telecommunications form for contact point.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: value
element.definition: The actual contact point details, in a form that is meaningful to the designated communication system (i.e. phone number or email address).
element.comment: Additional text data such as phone extension numbers, or notes about use of the contact are sometimes included in the value.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: use
element.description: home | work | temp | old | mobile - purpose of this contact point
element.definition: Identifies the purpose for the contact point.
element.comment: Applications can assume that a contact is current unless it explicitly says that it is temporary or old.

binding.name: ContactPointUse
binding.description: Use of contact point.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: rank
element.description: Specify preferred order of use (1 = highest)
element.definition: Specifies a preferred order in which to use a set of contacts. ContactPoints with lower rank values are more preferred than those with higher rank values.
element.comment: Note that rank does not necessarily follow the order in which the contacts are represented in the instance.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: period
element.description: Time period when the contact point was/is in use
element.definition: Time period when the contact point was/is in use.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: type
element.definition: The type of contributor.

binding.name: ContributorType
binding.description: The type of contributor.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: name
element.definition: The name of the individual or organization responsible for the contribution.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the contributor.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: type
element.description: The type of the required data
element.definition: The type of the required data, specified as the type name of a resource. For profiles, this value is set to the type of the base resource of the profile.

binding.name: FHIRAllTypes
binding.description: A list of all the concrete types defined in this version of the FHIR specification - Abstract Types, Data Types and Resource Types.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: profile
element.description: The profile of the required data
element.definition: The profile of the required data, specified as the uri of the profile definition.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: subject
element.description: E.g. Patient, Practitioner, RelatedPerson, Organization, Location, Device
element.definition: The intended subjects of the data requirement. If this element is not provided, a Patient subject is assumed.
element.comment: The subject of a data requirement is critical, as the data being specified is determined with respect to a particular subject. This corresponds roughly to the notion of a Compartment in that it limits what data is available based on its relationship to the subject. In CQL, this corresponds to the context declaration.

binding.name: SubjectType
binding.description: The possible types of subjects for a data requirement (E.g., Patient, Practitioner, Organization, Location, etc.).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: mustSupport
element.description: Indicates specific structure elements that are referenced by the knowledge module
element.definition:
Indicates that specific elements of the type are referenced by the knowledge module and must be supported by the consumer in order to obtain an effective evaluation. This does not mean that a value is required for this element, only that the consuming system must understand the element and be able to provide values for it if they are available.
The value of mustSupport SHALL be a FHIRPath resolveable on the type of the DataRequirement. The path SHALL consist only of identifiers, constant indexers, and .resolve() (see the [Simple FHIRPath Profile](fhirpath.html#simple) for full details).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: codeFilter
element.definition: Code filters specify additional constraints on the data, specifying the value set of interest for a particular element of the data. Each code filter defines an additional constraint on the data, i.e. code filters are AND'ed, not OR'ed.

constraint.name: drq-1
constraint.message: Either a path or a searchParam must be provided, but not both

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: dateFilter
element.definition: Date filters specify additional constraints on the data in terms of the applicable date range for specific elements. Each date filter specifies an additional constraint on the data, i.e. date filters are AND'ed, not OR'ed.

constraint.name: drq-2
constraint.message: Either a path or a searchParam must be provided, but not both

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: limit
element.definition: Specifies a maximum number of results that are required (uses the _count search parameter).
element.comment: This element can be used in combination with the sort element to specify quota requirements such as "the most recent 5" or "the highest 5".

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: sort
element.definition: Specifies the order of the results to be returned.
element.comment: This element can be used in combination with the sort element to specify quota requirements such as "the most recent 5" or "the highest 5". When multiple sorts are specified, they are applied in the order they appear in the resource.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: path
element.description: A code-valued attribute to filter on
element.definition: The code-valued attribute of the filter. The specified path SHALL be a FHIRPath resolveable on the specified type of the DataRequirement, and SHALL consist only of identifiers, constant indexers, and .resolve(). The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements (see the [Simple FHIRPath Profile](fhirpath.html#simple) for full details). Note that the index must be an integer constant. The path must resolve to an element of type code, Coding, or CodeableConcept.
element.comment: The path attribute contains a [Simple FHIRPath Subset](fhirpath.html#simple) that allows path traversal, but not calculation.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: searchParam
element.description: A coded (token) parameter to search on
element.definition: A token parameter that refers to a search parameter defined on the specified type of the DataRequirement, and which searches on elements of type code, Coding, or CodeableConcept.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: valueSet
element.definition: The valueset for the code filter. The valueSet and code elements are additive. If valueSet is specified, the filter will return only those data items for which the value of the code-valued element specified in the path is a member of the specified valueset.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: code
element.definition: The codes for the code filter. If values are given, the filter will return only those data items for which the code-valued attribute specified by the path has a value that is one of the specified codes. If codes are specified in addition to a value set, the filter returns items matching a code in the value set or one of the specified codes.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: path
element.description: A date-valued attribute to filter on
element.definition: The date-valued attribute of the filter. The specified path SHALL be a FHIRPath resolveable on the specified type of the DataRequirement, and SHALL consist only of identifiers, constant indexers, and .resolve(). The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements (see the [Simple FHIRPath Profile](fhirpath.html#simple) for full details). Note that the index must be an integer constant. The path must resolve to an element of type date, dateTime, Period, Schedule, or Timing.
element.comment: The path attribute contains a [Simple FHIR Subset](fhirpath.html#simple) that allows path traversal, but not calculation.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: searchParam
element.description: A date valued parameter to search on
element.definition: A date parameter that refers to a search parameter defined on the specified type of the DataRequirement, and which searches on elements of type date, dateTime, Period, Schedule, or Timing.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: value
element.description: The value of the filter, as a Period, DateTime, or Duration value
element.definition: The value of the filter. If period is specified, the filter will return only those data items that fall within the bounds determined by the Period, inclusive of the period boundaries. If dateTime is specified, the filter will return only those data items that are equal to the specified dateTime. If a Duration is specified, the filter will return only those data items that fall within Duration before now.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: path
element.description: The name of the attribute to perform the sort
element.definition: The attribute of the sort. The specified path must be resolvable from the type of the required data. The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements. Note that the index must be an integer constant.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: direction
element.definition: The direction of the sort, ascending or descending.

binding.name: SortDirection
binding.description: The possible sort directions, ascending or descending.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: name
element.definition: The name of the device.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: type
element.description: udi-label-name | user-friendly-name | patient-reported-name | manufacturer-name | model-name | other
element.definition: The type of deviceName. UDILabelName | UserFriendlyName | PatientReportedName | ManufactureDeviceName | ModelName.

binding.name: DeviceNameType
binding.description: The type of name the device is referred by.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: type
element.description: Code that specifies the property DeviceDefinitionPropetyCode (Extensible)
element.definition: Code that specifies the property DeviceDefinitionPropetyCode (Extensible).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: valueQuantity
element.definition: Property value as a quantity.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: valueCode
element.description: Property value as a code, e.g., NTP4 (synced to NTP)
element.definition: Property value as a code, e.g., NTP4 (synced to NTP).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: systemType
element.description: The standard that is used to operate and communicate
element.definition: The standard that is used to operate and communicate.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: version
element.description: The version of the standard that is used to operate and communicate
element.definition: The version of the standard that is used to operate and communicate.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: deviceIdentifier
element.definition: The device identifier (DI) is a mandatory, fixed portion of a UDI that identifies the labeler and the specific version or model of a device.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: issuer
element.definition: Organization that is charged with issuing UDIs for devices. For example, the US FDA issuers include : 1) GS1: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/gs1-di, 2) HIBCC: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc-dI, 3) ICCBBA for blood containers: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-blood-di, 4) ICCBA for other devices: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-other-di.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: jurisdiction
element.definition: The identity of the authoritative source for UDI generation within a jurisdiction. All UDIs are globally unique within a single namespace with the appropriate repository uri as the system. For example, UDIs of devices managed in the U.S. by the FDA, the value is http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/fda-udi.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: carrierAIDC
element.definition: The full UDI carrier of the Automatic Identification and Data Capture (AIDC) technology representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device - e.g., a barcode or RFID. Because of limitations on character sets in XML and the need to round-trip JSON data through XML, AIDC Formats *SHALL* be base64 encoded.
element.comment: The AIDC form of UDIs should be scanned or otherwise used for the identification of the device whenever possible to minimize errors in records resulting from manual transcriptions. If separate barcodes for DI and PI are present, concatenate the string with DI first and in order of human readable expression on label.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: carrierHRF
element.definition: The full UDI carrier as the human readable form (HRF) representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device.
element.comment: If separate barcodes for DI and PI are present, concatenate the string with DI first and in order of human readable expression on label.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: entryType
element.definition: A coded entry to indicate how the data was entered.

binding.name: UDIEntryType
binding.description: Codes to identify how UDI data was entered.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: type
element.description: The type of the device version
element.definition: The type of the device version.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: component
element.description: A single component of the device version
element.definition: A single component of the device version.
