A small number of vaccines (e.g. live oral typhoid vaccine) are given as a series of patient self-administered dose over a span of time. In cases like this, often, only the first dose (typically a provider supervised dose) is recorded with the occurrence indicating the date/time of the first dose.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: recorded
element.description: When the immunization was first captured in the subject's record
element.definition: The date the occurrence of the immunization was first captured in the record - potentially significantly after the occurrence of the event.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: primarySource
element.description: Indicates context the data was recorded in
element.definition: An indication that the content of the record is based on information from the person who administered the vaccine. This reflects the context under which the data was originally recorded.
element.comment: Reflects the “reliability” of the content.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: reportOrigin
element.description: Indicates the source of a secondarily reported record
element.definition: The source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person who administered the vaccine.
element.comment: Should not be populated if primarySource = True, not required even if primarySource = False.

binding.name: ImmunizationReportOrigin
binding.description: The source of the data for a record which is not from a primary source.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: location
element.definition: The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: manufacturer
element.definition: Name of vaccine manufacturer.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: lotNumber
element.definition: Lot number of the vaccine product.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: expirationDate
element.definition: Date vaccine batch expires.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: site
element.definition: Body site where vaccine was administered.

binding.name: ImmunizationSite
binding.description: The site at which the vaccine was administered.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: route
element.definition: The path by which the vaccine product is taken into the body.

binding.name: ImmunizationRoute
binding.description: The route by which the vaccine was administered.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: doseQuantity
element.definition: The quantity of vaccine product that was administered.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: performer
element.definition: Indicates who performed the immunization event.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: note
element.definition: Extra information about the immunization that is not conveyed by the other attributes.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: reasonCode
element.definition: Reasons why the vaccine was administered.

binding.name: ImmunizationReason
binding.description: The reason why a vaccine was administered.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: reasonReference
element.definition: Condition, Observation or DiagnosticReport that supports why the immunization was administered.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: isSubpotent
element.definition: Indication if a dose is considered to be subpotent. By default, a dose should be considered to be potent.
element.comment: Typically, the recognition of the dose being sub-potent is retrospective, after the administration (ex. notification of a manufacturer recall after administration). However, in the case of a partial administration (the patient moves unexpectedly and only some of the dose is actually administered), subpotency may be recognized immediately, but it is still important to record the event.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: subpotentReason
element.definition: Reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent.

binding.name: SubpotentReason
binding.description: The reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: education
element.definition: Educational material presented to the patient (or guardian) at the time of vaccine administration.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

constraint.name: imm-1
constraint.message: One of documentType or reference SHALL be present

element.name: programEligibility
element.description: Patient eligibility for a vaccination program
element.definition: Indicates a patient's eligibility for a funding program.

binding.name: ProgramEligibility
binding.description: The patient's eligibility for a vaccation program.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: fundingSource
element.definition: Indicates the source of the vaccine actually administered. This may be different than the patient eligibility (e.g. the patient may be eligible for a publically purchased vaccine but due to inventory issues, vaccine purchased with private funds was actually administered).

binding.name: FundingSource
binding.description: The source of funding used to purchase the vaccine administered.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: reaction
element.description: Details of a reaction that follows immunization
element.definition: Categorical data indicating that an adverse event is associated in time to an immunization.
element.comment: A reaction may be an indication of an allergy or intolerance and, if this is determined to be the case, it should be recorded as a new AllergyIntolerance resource instance as most systems will not query against past Immunization.reaction elements.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: protocolApplied
element.definition: The protocol (set of recommendations) being followed by the provider who administered the dose.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Unique instance identifiers assigned to a device by manufacturers other organizations or owners.
element.comment: The barcode string from a barcode present on a device label or package may identify the instance, include names given to the device in local usage, or may identify the type of device. If the identifier identifies the type of device, Device.type element should be used.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: definition
element.description: The reference to the definition for the device
element.definition: The reference to the definition for the device.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: udiCarrier
element.definition: Unique device identifier (UDI) assigned to device label or package. Note that the Device may include multiple udiCarriers as it either may include just the udiCarrier for the jurisdiction it is sold, or for multiple jurisdictions it could have been sold.
element.comment: Some devices may not have UDI information (for example. historical data or patient reported data).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: status
element.definition: Status of the Device availability.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the codes inactive and entered-in-error that mark the device (record)as not currently valid.

binding.name: FHIRDeviceStatus
binding.description: The availability status of the device.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: statusReason
element.description: online | paused | standby | offline | not-ready | transduc-discon | hw-discon | off
element.definition: Reason for the dtatus of the Device availability.

binding.name: FHIRDeviceStatusReason
binding.description: The availability status reason of the device.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: distinctIdentifier
element.definition: The distinct identification string as required by regulation for a human cell, tissue, or cellular and tissue-based product.
element.comment: For example, this applies to devices in the United States regulated under *Code of Federal Regulation 21CFR§1271.290(c)*.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: manufacturer
element.definition: A name of the manufacturer.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: manufactureDate
element.description: Date when the device was made
element.definition: The date and time when the device was manufactured.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: expirationDate
element.description: Date and time of expiry of this device (if applicable)
element.definition: The date and time beyond which this device is no longer valid or should not be used (if applicable).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: lotNumber
element.definition: Lot number assigned by the manufacturer.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: serialNumber
element.description: Serial number assigned by the manufacturer
element.definition: The serial number assigned by the organization when the device was manufactured.
element.comment: Alphanumeric Maximum 20.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: deviceName
element.description: The name of the device as given by the manufacturer
element.definition: This represents the manufacturer's name of the device as provided by the device, from a UDI label, or by a person describing the Device. This typically would be used when a person provides the name(s) or when the device represents one of the names available from DeviceDefinition.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: modelNumber
element.description: The model number for the device
element.definition: The model number for the device.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: partNumber
element.description: The part number of the device
element.definition: The part number of the device.
element.comment: Alphanumeric Maximum 20.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: type
element.description: The kind or type of device
element.definition: The kind or type of device.

binding.description: Codes to identify medical devices

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: specialization
element.description: The capabilities supported on a device, the standards to which the device conforms for a particular purpose, and used for the communication
element.definition: The capabilities supported on a device, the standards to which the device conforms for a particular purpose, and used for the communication.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: version
element.description: The actual design of the device or software version running on the device
element.definition: The actual design of the device or software version running on the device.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: property
element.description: The actual configuration settings of a device as it actually operates, e.g., regulation status, time properties
element.definition: The actual configuration settings of a device as it actually operates, e.g., regulation status, time properties.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: patient
element.description: Patient to whom Device is affixed
element.definition: Patient information, If the device is affixed to a person.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: owner
element.definition: An organization that is responsible for the provision and ongoing maintenance of the device.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details for an organization or a particular human that is responsible for the device.
element.comment: used for troubleshooting etc.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: location
element.definition: The place where the device can be found.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: url
element.definition: A network address on which the device may be contacted directly.
element.comment: If the device is running a FHIR server, the network address should be the Base URL from which a conformance statement may be retrieved.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: note
element.definition: Descriptive information, usage information or implantation information that is not captured in an existing element.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: safety
element.definition: Provides additional safety characteristics about a medical device. For example devices containing latex.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: parent
element.definition: The parent device.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

typeInfo.name: LaboratoryResultObservationProfile
typeInfo.label: US Core Laboratory Result Observation Profile

element.name: identifier
element.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this observation.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: basedOn
element.definition: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event. For example, a MedicationRequest may require a patient to have laboratory test performed before it is dispensed.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: partOf
element.definition: A larger event of which this particular Observation is a component or step. For example, an observation as part of a procedure.
element.comment: To link an Observation to an Encounter use `encounter`. See the [Notes](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/observation.html#obsgrouping) below for guidance on referencing another Observation.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of the result value.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: category
element.definition: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made.
element.comment: In addition to the required category valueset, this element allows various categorization schemes based on the owner’s definition of the category and effectively multiple categories can be used at once. The level of granularity is defined by the category concepts in the value set.

binding.name: ObservationCategory
binding.description: Codes for high level observation categories.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: Laboratory
element.definition: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made.
element.comment: In addition to the required category valueset, this element allows various categorization schemes based on the owner’s definition of the category and effectively multiple categories can be used at once. The level of granularity is defined by the category concepts in the value set.

binding.name: ObservationCategory
binding.description: Codes for high level observation categories.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: code
element.definition: The test that was performed. A LOINC **SHALL** be used if the concept is present in LOINC.
element.comment: The typical patterns for codes are: 1) a LOINC code either as a translation from a "local" code or as a primary code, or 2) a local code only if no suitable LOINC exists, or 3) both the local and the LOINC translation. Systems SHALL be capable of sending the local code if one exists. When using LOINC , Use either the SHORTNAME or LONG_COMMON_NAME field for the display.

binding.description: LOINC codes

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: subject
element.description: Who and/or what the observation is about
element.definition: The patient, or group of patients, location, or device this observation is about and into whose record the observation is placed. If the actual focus of the observation is different from the subject (or a sample of, part, or region of the subject), the `focus` element or the `code` itself specifies the actual focus of the observation.
element.comment: One would expect this element to be a cardinality of 1..1. The only circumstance in which the subject can be missing is when the observation is made by a device that does not know the patient. In this case, the observation SHALL be matched to a patient through some context/channel matching technique, and at this point, the observation should be updated.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: focus
element.description: What the observation is about, when it is not about the subject of record
element.definition: The actual focus of an observation when it is not the patient of record representing something or someone associated with the patient such as a spouse, parent, fetus, or donor. For example, fetus observations in a mother's record. The focus of an observation could also be an existing condition, an intervention, the subject's diet, another observation of the subject, or a body structure such as tumor or implanted device. An example use case would be using the Observation resource to capture whether the mother is trained to change her child's tracheostomy tube. In this example, the child is the patient of record and the mother is the focus.
element.comment: Typically, an observation is made about the subject - a patient, or group of patients, location, or device - and the distinction between the subject and what is directly measured for an observation is specified in the observation code itself ( e.g., "Blood Glucose") and does not need to be represented separately using this element. Use `specimen` if a reference to a specimen is required. If a code is required instead of a resource use either `bodysite` for bodysites or the standard extension [focusCode](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extension-observation-focuscode.html).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: encounter
element.description: Healthcare event during which this observation is made
element.definition: The healthcare event (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this observation is made.
element.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some events may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter (e.g. pre-admission laboratory tests).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: effective
element.definition: For lab tests this is the specimen collection date. For Ask at Order Entry Questions (AOE)'s this is the date the question was asked.
element.comment: At least a date should be present unless this observation is a historical report. For recording imprecise or "fuzzy" times (For example, a blood glucose measurement taken "after breakfast") use the [Timing](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#timing) datatype which allow the measurement to be tied to regular life events.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

constraint.name: us-core-1
constraint.message: Datetime must be at least to day.

element.name: issued
element.description: Date/Time this version was made available
element.definition: The date and time this version of the observation was made available to providers, typically after the results have been reviewed and verified.
element.comment: For Observations that don’t require review and verification, it may be the same as the [`lastUpdated` ](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/resource-definitions.html#Meta.lastUpdated) time of the resource itself. For Observations that do require review and verification for certain updates, it might not be the same as the `lastUpdated` time of the resource itself due to a non-clinically significant update that doesn’t require the new version to be reviewed and verified again.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: performer
element.description: Who is responsible for the observation
element.definition: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true".

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: value
element.definition: The Laboratory result value. If a coded value, the valueCodeableConcept.code **SHOULD** be selected from [SNOMED CT](http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/uslab-obs-codedresults). If a numeric value, valueQuantity.code **SHALL** be selected from [UCUM](http://unitsofmeasure.org). A FHIR [UCUM Codes value set](http://hl7.org/fhir/STU3/valueset-ucum-units.html) that defines all UCUM codes is in the FHIR specification.
element.comment: An observation may have; 1) a single value here, 2) both a value and a set of related or component values, or 3) only a set of related or component values. If a value is present, the datatype for this element should be determined by Observation.code. A CodeableConcept with just a text would be used instead of a string if the field was usually coded, or if the type associated with the Observation.code defines a coded value. For additional guidance, see the [Notes section](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/observation.html#notes) below.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

constraint.name: us-core-4
constraint.message: SHOULD use Snomed CT for coded Results

constraint.name: us-core-3
constraint.message: SHALL use UCUM for coded quantity units.

element.name: dataAbsentReason
element.definition: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.
element.comment:
Null or exceptional values can be represented two ways in FHIR Observations. One way is to simply include them in the value set and represent the exceptions in the value. For example, measurement values for a serology test could be "detected", "not detected", "inconclusive", or "specimen unsatisfactory".
The alternate way is to use the value element for actual observations and use the explicit dataAbsentReason element to record exceptional values. For example, the dataAbsentReason code "error" could be used when the measurement was not completed. Note that an observation may only be reported if there are values to report. For example differential cell counts values may be reported only when > 0. Because of these options, use-case agreements are required to interpret general observations for null or exceptional values.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: interpretation
element.definition: A categorical assessment of an observation value. For example, high, low, normal.
element.comment: Historically used for laboratory results (known as 'abnormal flag' ), its use extends to other use cases where coded interpretations are relevant. Often reported as one or more simple compact codes this element is often placed adjacent to the result value in reports and flow sheets to signal the meaning/normalcy status of the result.

binding.name: ObservationInterpretation
binding.description: Codes identifying interpretations of observations.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: note
element.definition: Comments about the observation or the results.
element.comment: May include general statements about the observation, or statements about significant, unexpected or unreliable results values, or information about its source when relevant to its interpretation.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: bodySite
element.definition: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the observation was made (i.e. the target site).
element.comment:
Only used if not implicit in code found in Observation.code. In many systems, this may be represented as a related observation instead of an inline component.
If the use case requires BodySite to be handled as a separate resource (e.g. to identify and track separately) then use the standard extension[ bodySite](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extension-bodysite.html).

binding.name: BodySite
binding.description: Codes describing anatomical locations. May include laterality.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: method
element.definition: Indicates the mechanism used to perform the observation.
element.comment: Only used if not implicit in code for Observation.code.

binding.name: ObservationMethod
binding.description: Methods for simple observations.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: specimen
element.definition: The specimen that was used when this observation was made.
element.comment: Should only be used if not implicit in code found in `Observation.code`. Observations are not made on specimens themselves; they are made on a subject, but in many cases by the means of a specimen. Note that although specimens are often involved, they are not always tracked and reported explicitly. Also note that observation resources may be used in contexts that track the specimen explicitly (e.g. Diagnostic Report).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: device
element.definition: The device used to generate the observation data.
element.comment: Note that this is not meant to represent a device involved in the transmission of the result, e.g., a gateway. Such devices may be documented using the Provenance resource where relevant.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: referenceRange
element.definition: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range. Multiple reference ranges are interpreted as an "OR". In other words, to represent two distinct target populations, two `referenceRange` elements would be used.
element.comment: Most observations only have one generic reference range. Systems MAY choose to restrict to only supplying the relevant reference range based on knowledge about the patient (e.g., specific to the patient's age, gender, weight and other factors), but this might not be possible or appropriate. Whenever more than one reference range is supplied, the differences between them SHOULD be provided in the reference range and/or age properties.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

constraint.name: obs-3
constraint.message: Must have at least a low or a high or text

element.name: hasMember
element.description: Related resource that belongs to the Observation group
element.definition: This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.
element.comment: When using this element, an observation will typically have either a value or a set of related resources, although both may be present in some cases. For a discussion on the ways Observations can assembled in groups together, see [Notes](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/observation.html#obsgrouping) below. Note that a system may calculate results from [QuestionnaireResponse](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/questionnaireresponse.html) into a final score and represent the score as an Observation.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: derivedFrom
element.description: Related measurements the observation is made from
element.definition: The target resource that represents a measurement from which this observation value is derived. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.
element.comment: All the reference choices that are listed in this element can represent clinical observations and other measurements that may be the source for a derived value. The most common reference will be another Observation. For a discussion on the ways Observations can assembled in groups together, see [Notes](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/observation.html#obsgrouping) below.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: component
element.definition: Some observations have multiple component observations. These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes. Examples include systolic and diastolic component observations for blood pressure measurement and multiple component observations for genetics observations.
element.comment: For a discussion on the ways Observations can be assembled in groups together see [Notes](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/observation.html#notes) below.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: identifier
element.description: Unique code or number identifying the location to its users
element.definition: Unique code or number identifying the location to its users.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: status
element.definition: The status property covers the general availability of the resource, not the current value which may be covered by the operationStatus, or by a schedule/slots if they are configured for the location.

binding.name: LocationStatus
binding.description: Indicates whether the location is still in use.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: operationalStatus
element.description: The operational status of the location (typically only for a bed/room)
element.definition: The operational status covers operation values most relevant to beds (but can also apply to rooms/units/chairs/etc. such as an isolation unit/dialysis chair). This typically covers concepts such as contamination, housekeeping, and other activities like maintenance.

binding.name: OperationalStatus
binding.description: The operational status if the location (where typically a bed/room).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: name
element.description: Name of the location as used by humans
element.definition: Name of the location as used by humans. Does not need to be unique.
element.comment: If the name of a location changes, consider putting the old name in the alias column so that it can still be located through searches.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: alias
element.description: A list of alternate names that the location is known as, or was known as, in the past
element.definition: A list of alternate names that the location is known as, or was known as, in the past.
element.comment: There are no dates associated with the alias/historic names, as this is not intended to track when names were used, but to assist in searching so that older names can still result in identifying the location.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: description
element.description: Additional details about the location that could be displayed as further information to identify the location beyond its name
element.definition: Description of the Location, which helps in finding or referencing the place.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: mode
element.definition: Indicates whether a resource instance represents a specific location or a class of locations.
element.comment: This is labeled as a modifier because whether or not the location is a class of locations changes how it can be used and understood.

binding.name: LocationMode
binding.description: Indicates whether a resource instance represents a specific location or a class of locations.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: type
element.definition: Indicates the type of function performed at the location.

binding.name: LocationType
binding.description: Indicates the type of function performed at the location.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: telecom
element.definition: The contact details of communication devices available at the location. This can include phone numbers, fax numbers, mobile numbers, email addresses and web sites.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: address
element.definition: Physical location.
element.comment: Additional addresses should be recorded using another instance of the Location resource, or via the Organization.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: physicalType
element.definition: Physical form of the location, e.g. building, room, vehicle, road.

binding.name: PhysicalType
binding.description: Physical form of the location.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: position
element.definition: The absolute geographic location of the Location, expressed using the WGS84 datum (This is the same co-ordinate system used in KML).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: managingOrganization
element.description: Organization responsible for provisioning and upkeep
element.definition: The organization responsible for the provisioning and upkeep of the location.
element.comment: This can also be used as the part of the organization hierarchy where this location provides services. These services can be defined through the HealthcareService resource.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: partOf
element.description: Another Location this one is physically a part of
element.definition: Another Location of which this Location is physically a part of.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: hoursOfOperation
element.description: What days/times during a week is this location usually open
element.definition: What days/times during a week is this location usually open.
element.comment:
This type of information is commonly found published in directories and on websites informing customers when the facility is available.
Specific services within the location may have their own hours which could be shorter (or longer) than the locations hours.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: availabilityExceptions
element.definition: A description of when the locations opening ours are different to normal, e.g. public holiday availability. Succinctly describing all possible exceptions to normal site availability as detailed in the opening hours Times.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: endpoint
element.description: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the location
element.definition: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the location.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: daysOfWeek
element.description: mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun
element.definition: Indicates which days of the week are available between the start and end Times.

binding.name: DaysOfWeek
binding.description: The days of the week.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: allDay
element.description: The Location is open all day
element.definition: The Location is open all day.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: openingTime
element.definition: Time that the Location opens.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: closingTime
element.definition: Time that the Location closes.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: longitude
element.definition: Longitude. The value domain and the interpretation are the same as for the text of the longitude element in KML (see notes below).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: latitude
element.definition: Latitude. The value domain and the interpretation are the same as for the text of the latitude element in KML (see notes below).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: altitude
element.definition: Altitude. The value domain and the interpretation are the same as for the text of the altitude element in KML (see notes below).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: lotNumber
element.definition: The assigned lot number of a batch of the specified product.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: expirationDate
element.definition: When this specific batch of product will expire.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: item
element.definition: The actual ingredient - either a substance (simple ingredient) or another medication of a medication.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: isActive
element.definition: Indication of whether this ingredient affects the therapeutic action of the drug.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: strength
element.definition: Specifies how many (or how much) of the items there are in this Medication. For example, 250 mg per tablet. This is expressed as a ratio where the numerator is 250mg and the denominator is 1 tablet.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Business identifier for this medication.
element.comment: The serial number could be included as an identifier.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: code
element.definition: A code (or set of codes) that specify this medication, or a textual description if no code is available. Usage note: This could be a standard medication code such as a code from RxNorm, SNOMED CT, IDMP etc. It could also be a national or local formulary code, optionally with translations to other code systems.
element.comment: Depending on the context of use, the code that was actually selected by the user (prescriber, dispenser, etc.) will have the coding.userSelected set to true. As described in the coding datatype: "A coding may be marked as a "userSelected" if a user selected the particular coded value in a user interface (e.g. the user selects an item in a pick-list). If a user selected coding exists, it is the preferred choice for performing translations etc. Other codes can only be literal translations to alternative code systems, or codes at a lower level of granularity (e.g. a generic code for a vendor-specific primary one).

binding.description: Prescribable medications

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: status
element.definition: A code to indicate if the medication is in active use.
element.comment: This status is intended to identify if the medication in a local system is in active use within a drug database or inventory. For example, a pharmacy system may create a new drug file record for a compounded product "ABC Hospital Special Cream" with an active status. At some point in the future, it may be determined that the drug record was created with an error and the status is changed to "entered in error". This status is not intended to specify if a medication is part of a particular formulary. It is possible that the drug record may be referenced by multiple formularies or catalogues and each of those entries would have a separate status.

binding.name: MedicationStatus
binding.description: A coded concept defining if the medication is in active use.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: manufacturer
element.definition: Describes the details of the manufacturer of the medication product. This is not intended to represent the distributor of a medication product.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: form
element.definition: Describes the form of the item. Powder; tablets; capsule.
element.comment: When Medication is referenced from MedicationRequest, this is the ordered form. When Medication is referenced within MedicationDispense, this is the dispensed form. When Medication is referenced within MedicationAdministration, this is administered form.

binding.name: MedicationForm
binding.description: A coded concept defining the form of a medication.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: amount
element.definition: Specific amount of the drug in the packaged product. For example, when specifying a product that has the same strength (For example, Insulin glargine 100 unit per mL solution for injection), this attribute provides additional clarification of the package amount (For example, 3 mL, 10mL, etc.).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: ingredient
element.definition: Identifies a particular constituent of interest in the product.
element.comment: The ingredients need not be a complete list. If an ingredient is not specified, this does not indicate whether an ingredient is present or absent. If an ingredient is specified it does not mean that all ingredients are specified. It is possible to specify both inactive and active ingredients.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: batch
element.definition: Information that only applies to packages (not products).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: initialFill
element.definition: Indicates the quantity or duration for the first dispense of the medication.
element.comment: If populating this element, either the quantity or the duration must be included.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: dispenseInterval
element.description: Minimum period of time between dispenses
element.definition: The minimum period of time that must occur between dispenses of the medication.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: validityPeriod
element.description: Time period supply is authorized for
element.definition: This indicates the validity period of a prescription (stale dating the Prescription).
element.comment: It reflects the prescribers' perspective for the validity of the prescription. Dispenses must not be made against the prescription outside of this period. The lower-bound of the Dispensing Window signifies the earliest date that the prescription can be filled for the first time. If an upper-bound is not specified then the Prescription is open-ended or will default to a stale-date based on regulations.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: numberOfRepeatsAllowed
element.definition: An integer indicating the number of times, in addition to the original dispense, (aka refills or repeats) that the patient can receive the prescribed medication. Usage Notes: This integer does not include the original order dispense. This means that if an order indicates dispense 30 tablets plus "3 repeats", then the order can be dispensed a total of 4 times and the patient can receive a total of 120 tablets. A prescriber may explicitly say that zero refills are permitted after the initial dispense.
element.comment: If displaying "number of authorized fills", add 1 to this number.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: quantity
element.description: Amount of medication to supply per dispense
element.definition: The amount that is to be dispensed for one fill.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: expectedSupplyDuration
element.description: Number of days supply per dispense
element.definition: Identifies the period time over which the supplied product is expected to be used, or the length of time the dispense is expected to last.
element.comment: In some situations, this attribute may be used instead of quantity to identify the amount supplied by how long it is expected to last, rather than the physical quantity issued, e.g. 90 days supply of medication (based on an ordered dosage). When possible, it is always better to specify quantity, as this tends to be more precise. expectedSupplyDuration will always be an estimate that can be influenced by external factors.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: performer
element.definition: Indicates the intended dispensing Organization specified by the prescriber.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: quantity
element.definition: The amount or quantity to provide as part of the first dispense.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: duration
element.definition: The length of time that the first dispense is expected to last.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: allowed
element.description: Whether substitution is allowed or not
element.definition: True if the prescriber allows a different drug to be dispensed from what was prescribed.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because whether substitution is allow or not, it cannot be ignored.

binding.name: MedicationRequestSubstitution
binding.description: Identifies the type of substitution allowed.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: reason
element.definition: Indicates the reason for the substitution, or why substitution must or must not be performed.

binding.name: MedicationIntendedSubstitutionReason
binding.description: A coded concept describing the reason that a different medication should (or should not) be substituted from what was prescribed.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Identifiers associated with this medication request that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. They are business identifiers assigned to this resource by the performer or other systems and remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
element.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: status
element.description: active | on-hold | cancelled | completed | entered-in-error | stopped | draft | unknown
element.definition: A code specifying the current state of the order. Generally, this will be active or completed state.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.description: A code specifying the state of the prescribing event. Describes the lifecycle of the prescription.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: statusReason
element.definition: Captures the reason for the current state of the MedicationRequest.
element.comment: This is generally only used for "exception" statuses such as "suspended" or "cancelled". The reason why the MedicationRequest was created at all is captured in reasonCode, not here.

binding.name: MedicationRequestStatusReason
binding.description: Identifies the reasons for a given status.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: intent
element.description: proposal | plan | order | original-order | reflex-order | filler-order | instance-order | option
element.definition: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, or an original order.
element.comment: It is expected that the type of requester will be restricted for different stages of a MedicationRequest. For example, Proposals can be created by a patient, relatedPerson, Practitioner or Device. Plans can be created by Practitioners, Patients, RelatedPersons and Devices. Original orders can be created by a Practitioner only. An instance-order is an instantiation of a request or order and may be used to populate Medication Administration Record. This element is labeled as a modifier because the intent alters when and how the resource is actually applicable.

binding.description: The kind of medication order.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: category
element.definition: Indicates the type of medication request (for example, where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered (i.e. inpatient or outpatient)).
element.comment: The category can be used to include where the medication is expected to be consumed or other types of requests.

binding.name: MedicationRequestCategory
binding.description: A coded concept identifying the category of medication request. For example, where the medication is to be consumed or administered, or the type of medication treatment.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: priority
element.definition: Indicates how quickly the Medication Request should be addressed with respect to other requests.

binding.name: MedicationRequestPriority
binding.description: Identifies the level of importance to be assigned to actioning the request.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: doNotPerform
element.description: True if request is prohibiting action
element.definition: If true indicates that the provider is asking for the medication request not to occur.
element.comment: If do not perform is not specified, the request is a positive request e.g. "do perform".

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: reported
element.definition: Indicates if this record was captured as a secondary 'reported' record rather than as an original primary source-of-truth record. It may also indicate the source of the report.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: medication
element.definition: Identifies the medication being requested. This is a link to a resource that represents the medication which may be the details of the medication or simply an attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.
element.comment: If only a code is specified, then it needs to be a code for a specific product. If more information is required, then the use of the Medication resource is recommended. For example, if you require form or lot number or if the medication is compounded or extemporaneously prepared, then you must reference the Medication resource.

binding.description: Prescribable medications

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: subject
element.description: Who or group medication request is for
element.definition: A link to a resource representing the person or set of individuals to whom the medication will be given.
element.comment: The subject on a medication request is mandatory. For the secondary use case where the actual subject is not provided, there still must be an anonymized subject specified.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: encounter
element.description: Encounter created as part of encounter/admission/stay
element.definition: The Encounter during which this [x] was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
element.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter." If there is a need to link to episodes of care they will be handled with an extension.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: supportingInformation
element.description: Information to support ordering of the medication
element.definition: Include additional information (for example, patient height and weight) that supports the ordering of the medication.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: authoredOn
element.definition: The date (and perhaps time) when the prescription was initially written or authored on.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: requester
element.definition: The individual, organization, or device that initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: performer
element.definition: The specified desired performer of the medication treatment (e.g. the performer of the medication administration).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: performerType
element.description: Desired kind of performer of the medication administration
element.definition: Indicates the type of performer of the administration of the medication.
element.comment: If specified without indicating a performer, this indicates that the performer must be of the specified type. If specified with a performer then it indicates the requirements of the performer if the designated performer is not available.

binding.name: MedicationRequestPerformerType
binding.description: Identifies the type of individual that is desired to administer the medication.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: recorder
element.definition: The person who entered the order on behalf of another individual for example in the case of a verbal or a telephone order.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: reasonCode
element.description: Reason or indication for ordering or not ordering the medication
element.definition: The reason or the indication for ordering or not ordering the medication.
element.comment: This could be a diagnosis code. If a full condition record exists or additional detail is needed, use reasonReference.

binding.name: MedicationRequestReason
binding.description: A coded concept indicating why the medication was ordered.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: reasonReference
element.description: Condition or observation that supports why the prescription is being written
element.definition: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was ordered.
element.comment: This is a reference to a condition or observation that is the reason for the medication order. If only a code exists, use reasonCode.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: instantiatesCanonical
element.definition: The URL pointing to a protocol, guideline, orderset, or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this MedicationRequest.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: instantiatesUri
element.definition: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this MedicationRequest.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: basedOn
element.definition: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this medication request.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: groupIdentifier
element.description: Composite request this is part of
element.definition: A shared identifier common to all requests that were authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author, representing the identifier of the requisition or prescription.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: courseOfTherapyType
element.definition: The description of the overall patte3rn of the administration of the medication to the patient.
element.comment: This attribute should not be confused with the protocol of the medication.

binding.name: MedicationRequestCourseOfTherapy
binding.description: Identifies the overall pattern of medication administratio.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: insurance
element.definition: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be required for delivering the requested service.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: note
element.definition: Extra information about the prescription that could not be conveyed by the other attributes.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: dosageInstruction
element.description: How the medication should be taken
element.definition: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.
element.comment: There are examples where a medication request may include the option of an oral dose or an Intravenous or Intramuscular dose. For example, "Ondansetron 8mg orally or IV twice a day as needed for nausea" or "Compazine® (prochlorperazine) 5-10mg PO or 25mg PR bid prn nausea or vomiting". In these cases, two medication requests would be created that could be grouped together. The decision on which dose and route of administration to use is based on the patient's condition at the time the dose is needed.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: dispenseRequest
element.definition: Indicates the specific details for the dispense or medication supply part of a medication request (also known as a Medication Prescription or Medication Order). Note that this information is not always sent with the order. There may be in some settings (e.g. hospitals) institutional or system support for completing the dispense details in the pharmacy department.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: substitution
element.definition: Indicates whether or not substitution can or should be part of the dispense. In some cases, substitution must happen, in other cases substitution must not happen. This block explains the prescriber's intent. If nothing is specified substitution may be done.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: priorPrescription
element.description: An order/prescription that is being replaced
element.definition: A link to a resource representing an earlier order related order or prescription.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: detectedIssue
element.definition: Indicates an actual or potential clinical issue with or between one or more active or proposed clinical actions for a patient; e.g. Drug-drug interaction, duplicate therapy, dosage alert etc.
element.comment: This element can include a detected issue that has been identified either by a decision support system or by a clinician and may include information on the steps that were taken to address the issue.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: eventHistory
element.description: A list of events of interest in the lifecycle
element.definition: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this resource or fulfilling request or event resources that identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the resource.
element.comment: This might not include provenances for all versions of the request – only those deemed “relevant” or important. This SHALL NOT include the provenance associated with this current version of the resource. (If that provenance is deemed to be a “relevant” change, it will need to be added as part of a later update. Until then, it can be queried directly as the provenance that points to this version using _revinclude All Provenances should have some historical version of this Request as their subject.).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: versionId
element.definition: The version specific identifier, as it appears in the version portion of the URL. This value changes when the resource is created, updated, or deleted.
element.comment: The server assigns this value, and ignores what the client specifies, except in the case that the server is imposing version integrity on updates/deletes.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: lastUpdated
element.description: When the resource version last changed
element.definition: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.
element.comment: This value is always populated except when the resource is first being created. The server / resource manager sets this value; what a client provides is irrelevant. This is equivalent to the HTTP Last-Modified and SHOULD have the same value on a [read](http.html#read) interaction.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: source
element.description: Identifies where the resource comes from
element.definition: A uri that identifies the source system of the resource. This provides a minimal amount of [Provenance](provenance.html#) information that can be used to track or differentiate the source of information in the resource. The source may identify another FHIR server, document, message, database, etc.
element.comment:
In the provenance resource, this corresponds to Provenance.entity.what[x]. The exact use of the source (and the implied Provenance.entity.role) is left to implementer discretion. Only one nominated source is allowed; for additional provenance details, a full Provenance resource should be used.
This element can be used to indicate where the current master source of a resource that has a canonical URL if the resource is no longer hosted at the canonical URL.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: profile
element.description: Profiles this resource claims to conform to
element.definition: A list of profiles (references to [StructureDefinition](structuredefinition.html#) resources) that this resource claims to conform to. The URL is a reference to [StructureDefinition.url](structuredefinition-definitions.html#StructureDefinition.url).
element.comment: It is up to the server and/or other infrastructure of policy to determine whether/how these claims are verified and/or updated over time. The list of profile URLs is a set.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: security
element.description: Security Labels applied to this resource
element.definition: Security labels applied to this resource. These tags connect specific resources to the overall security policy and infrastructure.
element.comment: The security labels can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource. The list of security labels is a set. Uniqueness is based the system/code, and version and display are ignored.

binding.name: SecurityLabels
binding.description: Security Labels from the Healthcare Privacy and Security Classification System.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: tag
element.definition: Tags applied to this resource. Tags are intended to be used to identify and relate resources to process and workflow, and applications are not required to consider the tags when interpreting the meaning of a resource.
element.comment: The tags can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource. The list of tags is a set. Uniqueness is based the system/code, and version and display are ignored.

binding.name: Tags
binding.description: Codes that represent various types of tags, commonly workflow-related; e.g. "Needs review by Dr. Jones".

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of the narrative - whether it's entirely generated (from just the defined data or the extensions too), or whether a human authored it and it may contain additional data.

binding.name: NarrativeStatus
binding.description: The status of a resource narrative.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: div
element.definition: The actual narrative content, a stripped down version of XHTML.
element.comment: The contents of the html element are an XHTML fragment containing only the basic html formatting elements described in chapters 7-11 and 15 of the HTML 4.0 standard, <a> elements (either name or href), images and internally contained stylesheets. The XHTML content SHALL NOT contain a head, a body, external stylesheet references, scripts, forms, base/link/xlink, frames, iframes and objects.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

constraint.name: txt-1
constraint.message: The narrative SHALL contain only the basic html formatting elements and attributes described in chapters 7-11 (except section 4 of chapter 9) and 15 of the HTML 4.0 standard, <a> elements (either name or href), images and internally contained style attributes

constraint.name: txt-2
constraint.message: The narrative SHALL have some non-whitespace content

element.name: code
element.definition: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "code".
element.comment: *All* code-value and component.code-component.value pairs need to be taken into account to correctly understand the meaning of the observation.

binding.name: VitalSigns
binding.description: This identifies the vital sign result type.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: value
element.description: Vital Sign Value recorded with UCUM
element.definition: Vital Sign Value recorded with UCUM.
element.comment: Used when observation has a set of component observations. An observation may have both a value (e.g. an Apgar score) and component observations (the observations from which the Apgar score was derived). If a value is present, the datatype for this element should be determined by Observation.code. A CodeableConcept with just a text would be used instead of a string if the field was usually coded, or if the type associated with the Observation.code defines a coded value. For additional guidance, see the [Notes section](http://hl7.org/fhir/observation.html#notes) below.

binding.name: VitalSignsUnits
binding.description: Common UCUM units for recording Vital Signs.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: dataAbsentReason
element.description: Why the component result is missing
element.definition: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.component.value[x] is missing.
element.comment:
"Null" or exceptional values can be represented two ways in FHIR Observations. One way is to simply include them in the value set and represent the exceptions in the value. For example, measurement values for a serology test could be "detected", "not detected", "inconclusive", or "test not done".
The alternate way is to use the value element for actual observations and use the explicit dataAbsentReason element to record exceptional values. For example, the dataAbsentReason code "error" could be used when the measurement was not completed. Because of these options, use-case agreements are required to interpret general observations for exceptional values.

binding.name: ObservationValueAbsentReason
binding.description: Codes specifying why the result (`Observation.value[x]`) is missing.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: interpretation
element.definition: A categorical assessment of an observation value. For example, high, low, normal.
element.comment: Historically used for laboratory results (known as 'abnormal flag' ), its use extends to other use cases where coded interpretations are relevant. Often reported as one or more simple compact codes this element is often placed adjacent to the result value in reports and flow sheets to signal the meaning/normalcy status of the result.

binding.name: ObservationInterpretation
binding.description: Codes identifying interpretations of observations.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: referenceRange
element.description: Provides guide for interpretation of component result
element.definition: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.
element.comment: Most observations only have one generic reference range. Systems MAY choose to restrict to only supplying the relevant reference range based on knowledge about the patient (e.g., specific to the patient's age, gender, weight and other factors), but this might not be possible or appropriate. Whenever more than one reference range is supplied, the differences between them SHOULD be provided in the reference range and/or age properties.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: low
element.definition: The value of the low bound of the reference range. The low bound of the reference range endpoint is inclusive of the value (e.g. reference range is >=5 - <=9). If the low bound is omitted, it is assumed to be meaningless (e.g. reference range is <=2.3).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: high
element.definition: The value of the high bound of the reference range. The high bound of the reference range endpoint is inclusive of the value (e.g. reference range is >=5 - <=9). If the high bound is omitted, it is assumed to be meaningless (e.g. reference range is >= 2.3).

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: type
element.definition: Codes to indicate the what part of the targeted reference population it applies to. For example, the normal or therapeutic range.
element.comment: This SHOULD be populated if there is more than one range. If this element is not present then the normal range is assumed.

binding.name: ObservationRangeMeaning
binding.description: Code for the meaning of a reference range.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: appliesTo
element.definition: Codes to indicate the target population this reference range applies to. For example, a reference range may be based on the normal population or a particular sex or race. Multiple `appliesTo` are interpreted as an "AND" of the target populations. For example, to represent a target population of African American females, both a code of female and a code for African American would be used.
element.comment: This SHOULD be populated if there is more than one range. If this element is not present then the normal population is assumed.

binding.name: ObservationRangeType
binding.description: Codes identifying the population the reference range applies to.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: age
element.definition: The age at which this reference range is applicable. This is a neonatal age (e.g. number of weeks at term) if the meaning says so.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: text
element.description: Text based reference range in an observation
element.definition: Text based reference range in an observation which may be used when a quantitative range is not appropriate for an observation. An example would be a reference value of "Negative" or a list or table of "normals".

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: purpose
element.definition: Indicates a purpose for which the contact can be reached.

binding.name: ContactPartyType
binding.description: The purpose for which you would contact a contact party.

constraint.name: ele-1
constraint.message: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.description: A name associated with the contact
element.definition: A name associated with the contact.
